image.altText: Protesters walk along a street holding a massive sign that says 'CFMEU. Here to stay'.

props.synopsis: The former national president of the CFMEU launches a legal challenge to laws that force the construction union to accept an administrator, after allegations of criminal consorting, corruption and thuggery.

title.children: Former CFMEU heads launch high court challenge over forced administration

image.altText: A teenage boy in formal wear standing in an event hall with white chairs and cake

props.synopsis: The brother of 17-year-old boy Mehdi Habibi, who went missing in waters off Victor Harbor, has detailed the moments before the teenager fell from rocks during a family gathering at the popular tourist spot.

title.children: Missing teen's anguished family say he was posing for photo when he was swept off rocks

image.altText: Vincent is standing in front of an artwork of two dingos. His arms are folded and is wearing a button up shirt with a black hat

props.synopsis: Vincent Namatjira's latest exhibition, King Dingo, is designed to make people think about what a leader looks like.

title.children: Artist Vincent Namatjira explores leadership in new exhibition King Dingo

image.altText: Alan Kohler, dressed in a dark suit with a light patterned tie, is superimposed in front of Flinders St Station

props.synopsis:
Houses in Adelaide and Perth are now more expensive than in Melbourne after another month of divergence in Aussie housing.

But as Alan Kohler explains, Sydney is still the most expensive place in the country to buy a house.

title.children: Adelaide, Perth houses cost more than Melbourne

image.altText: A person wearing a keffiyeh holds their fingers up in a peace sign, a Palestinian flag is in the background.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Palestinian people apply for permanent protection as their tourist visas expire. Meanwhile the Coalition heaps pressure on the government after remarks made by ASIO boss Mike Burgess.

title.children: With expiring tourist visas, Palestinian people are applying for permanent protection in Australia

image.altText: A smaller boat next to a yacht in rough seas.

props.synopsis: A man and woman have been safely rescued from the stricken Spirit of Mateship yacht that is believed to be taking on water off the New South Wales south coast. A major joint operation was launched after a distress beacon was sent out yesterday.

title.children: Sydney to Hobart yacht abandoned off NSW coast after sailors rescued

image.altText: Zak Butters looks at the ball

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide skipper Connor Rozee says his vice-captain Zak Butters, who is suffering an eye infection, will be fine to play in the qualifying final.

title.children: Port dismiss mounting injury concerns ahead of qualifying final

image.altText: Dubbo Courthouse

props.synopsis: Gino Margiotta will remain behind bars for sexually assaulting a woman while travelling 13 years ago, an incident she says broke her "heart and trust".

title.children: South Australian man jailed for historical sexual assault in NSW

image.altText: The shadow of a young woman can be seen in front of the triple j sign

props.synopsis: Forced marriage is the most common form of human trafficking in Australia. We speak to a victim-survivor about how she escaped.

title.children: Aisha was engaged by the time she was 13. Within three years she'd taken her parents to court to escape a forced marriage

image.altText: Two workers in hi-vis walking in the snow.

props.synopsis: Police say they are "gobsmacked" and the premier calls it "stupidity" after a group of more than a dozen bushwalkers, including children, were rescued in treacherous weather conditions on kunanyi/Mt Wellington.

title.children: Police 'gobsmacked' after walkers, including kids, rescued on freezing kunanyi/Mt Wellington summit

image.altText: A young man in a tropical shirt with

props.synopsis: Six months after he was kidnapped into Gaza with a grisly injury, 23-year-old Hersh Goldberg-Polin stunned everyone by appearing alive in a hostage video. His sudden death at the weekend has galvanised a nation.

title.children: After surviving almost 11 months of abuse, six hostages died in a Hamas tunnel

image.altText: A man and woman stand next to each other in a country town.

props.synopsis: Stuart Harris was one of the first people on the scene of his 17-year-old daughter's fatal car crash. Advocates say it's all too common in regional areas.

title.children: Family members serve as first responders to rural road crashes amid calls for more support

image.altText: Mike Burgess wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Head of ASIO Mike Burgess says his comments on the vetting process for people fleeing Gaza were misrepresented, which starts a fresh blame game between the prime minister and opposition leader.

title.children: ASIO boss's clarification on Gaza visas sparks fresh political stoush between Dutton and Albanese

image.altText: A woman sitting at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Nine years after Japanese journalist Shiori Ito was allegedly raped by a powerful man, she has produced a documentary, Black Box Diaries, chronicling her road to justice.

title.children: Police considered Shiori Ito's rape case a 'black box'. She forced Japanese society to look inside

image.altText: A tennis player wearing a cap, T-shirt and short, reaches out with his racquet to hit a ball.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur sees off fellow Australian Jordan Thompson to book a place in the US Open quarterfinals.

title.children: De Minaur through to US Open quarterfinals after defeating fellow Australian Thompson

image.altText: Brittany Higgins walking into the ACT court with her head down.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's lawyer finishes her closing submissions in the defamation case launched by Senator Linda Reynolds, and these are the key ways the former staffer is defending herself against the allegations.

title.children: After weeks of testimony, we've finally heard how Brittany Higgins is defending allegations of defamation

image.altText: Electronic gaming machines at a gambling venue

props.synopsis: Australians lead the world when it comes to gambling. But the only area of gaming and gambling where we appear to be lacking is in the area of legislation and oversight.

title.children: Why Australia is addicted to gambling

image.altText: A graphic illustration shows a woman lying in bed staring at her phone in the dark

props.synopsis: We all know the pain of a blaring alarm clock after a late night, but sleep deprivation does more than just bring our mood down. This is what happens when you consistently short change yourself of a good night's rest.

title.children: Are you in the 25 per cent of people not getting enough sleep? Here's what it's doing to your body and brain

image.altText: George Alex at the trade union royal commission

props.synopsis: George Alex is one of five people to be found guilty of attempting to defraud the Commonwealth of more than $10 million.

title.children: Sydney construction boss found guilty of $10m ATO fraud after marathon trial

image.altText: Geo blowing vape towards the camera

props.synopsis: A survey of more than 5,000 year 7 and 8 students across three states found teenagers who vape were more likely to have poor mental health.

title.children: Geo started vaping at 13, a time experts say is crucial for the adolescent brain

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australia's balance of payments data is out, and it may have good news for the GDP figures expected on Wednesday. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX trading lower ahead of hotly anticipated GDP figures, while Australia's biggest bank reveals first home buyer trends

image.altText: Fire extinguisher tanks in a firefighters room.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has heard from more than a dozen people about allegations of a "macho hero" culture in Queensland's fire service.

title.children: 'Attractive' female firefighting recruits subjected to 'bell ringing' at Brisbane training academy

image.altText: A farm property and distiller filled with floodwater

props.synopsis: All emergency warnings in the state have been downgraded after rivers peaked and relatively calm weather held for today, with Tasmanians taking to counting the cost of the storms.

title.children: Tasmanians mop up after flooding as wild weather eases across state — as it happened

image.altText: Skyscapers make up a very business end of town skyline

props.synopsis: As Australian mortgage holders wait for relief, the Reserve Bank of New Zealand cuts rates and green shoots emerge in the housing market.

title.children: 'The first cut is the deepest': NZ's central bank has cut rates and economists are singing a different tune

image.altText: A logo on a vehicle reads "Queensland police".

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the sudden death of a one-year-old boy at a daycare centre in Brisbane's east.

title.children: Police investigate sudden death of 1yo boy at daycare centre in Brisbane's east

image.altText: Two Australian wheelchair rugby players sit on court in their chairs, smiling and holding an Australian flag behind them.

props.synopsis: Ryley Batt has been a great of wheelchair rugby for two decades, and the Australian star has had an almost-magical combination with teammate Chris Bond for four Paralympics. Batt finished with bronze in Paris, and it's time to be thankful for his brilliant Paralympic career, writes Andrew McGarry.

title.children: Wheelchair rugby great Ryley Batt ends Paralympic career with bronze for Australia

image.altText: A young boy wearing a blue hat uses a wooden paddle to scoop up glue to add to a small clay jar

props.synopsis: The child's father says he thought "please let that not be my child" after hearing a crash while touring artefacts in the Hecht Museum with his family.

title.children: Museum welcomes back boy who broke 3,500-year-old Bronze Age jar

image.altText: A woman in a wheelchair in parkland, with a baby strapped to her chest.

props.synopsis: Shelley Matheson says funding shortfalls have "decimated" her sport after returning to Australia's wheelchair basketball team following the birth of her second baby.

title.children: 'The women's program has been decimated': Paralympian calls for more support for wheelchair basketball

image.altText: A man holding a folder of papers walks next to a man with his head down, outside a building.

props.synopsis: Simon Arthur was overseas when police raided his house, before cutting his trip short and handing himself in when he returned to Australia.

title.children: Police allegedly find half-a-million dollars in cash, drug trafficking instructions at Canberra man's home

image.altText: Rebecca Pritchard smiles while standing with her husband and daughter.

props.synopsis: When financial planner Rebecca Pritchard was starting her family, she used a little-known strategy called contribution splitting to keep her superannuation ticking over.

title.children: The little-known strategy that can help couples address the gender super gap

props.synopsis: Country firefighters say modern house fires are hotter, longer and more intense than those in the past, and increasingly caused by batteries in devices like e-scooters and laptops.

title.children: Firefighters face growing danger as lithium-ion batteries spark more severe blazes

image.altText: A large group of people hold TWU banner saying 'Carrying Australia'

props.synopsis: The TWU says an internal investigation has forced the union to disband the Victorian-Tasmania branch, after it revealed significant issues and "unfounded" harassment allegations against its leadership.

title.children: Transport Workers' Union dissolves branch, claiming 'significant operational and cultural issues'

image.altText: A woman with long black hair wearing an olive shirt looks at the camera

props.synopsis: A teenager who died while locked up in youth detention would still be alive if he wasn't removed from a specialised care program, the organisation who ran it says.

title.children: Boy who died in WA's troubled youth detention system may be alive if he'd stayed in specialised care, organisation says

image.altText: Thumbnail pic of people near water's edge at Cahills Crossing.

props.synopsis: Rangers in Kakadu could crack down on visitors who are too relaxed around crocodiles inside the national park, with recent footage showing people close to the water's edge at the notorious Cahills Crossing.

title.children: Alarming' visitor behaviour at notorious Kakadu crocodile viewing spot prompt warnings of heftier fines

image.altText: An outstretched hand close-up with a gold nugget in the open palm.

props.synopsis: An earth-shaking experiment links the same principles found in your barbecue lighter to the creation of gold nuggets.

title.children: Gold nuggets are often found in quartz — scientists think they now know why
